content:
Hey guys! Hope you all had a good start into the summer. :sunny:
During the upcoming weekend, I will have the honor to teach some math undergraduates. I decided I want to teach them some Lean. :octopus: Since I am not an expert yet, I am not sure whether I will be able to answer all their questions. Do you mind if I put some questions here? Of course, I will also try to convince them to register to Zulip, so maybe they could also post their questions in the "general" or "is there code for X?" stream.
Hi Jana! Of course, please do feel free to post questions here. For them, I think it would be much better to post questions in the "new members" stream, unless they are specific.
Ah perfect, thanks for the suggestion Filippo!
Hey guys! A small update. Some of the undergraduates would like to get a bit further into lean in the future and are interested in events similar to LFTCM. Any suggestions?^^
They are a few upcoming workshops and conferences listed on the website, although they are not necessarily very similar to LFTCM: https://leanprover-community.github.io/events.html
Thanks! Yeah I think a tutorial would be best :) I will try to remind them when there is something coming up!
